ratings.comment: AVOID! Tough (unfair) grader, unclear grading criteria, little outside of the syllabus. Very reading heavy, more work than necessary for a 3-credit course. Boring lectures. Do NOT take to fulfill ethnic studies credit requirements. Also very hard to reach outside of class, not on campus outside of lectures, and not respondent to emails.

Professor Plummer gades arbitrarily. All tests and assignments are in the form of essays. She does not give a rubric with point breakdowns or explain why you lost points. Although she has a syllabus with a rough summary of expectations, even if you make sure to follow every general guideline you will still lose points no matter what. The average on

LOVED this class,lectures were mind blowing. Graded on midterm & final which each had 2 essays we got 8 prompts ahead of time with 6 of the prompts on each exam so you could write the essays before the exam). Led the class in a 10 minute discussion, and write two, 5 page papers on topic of choice, no other work. Would def take from her again!!

Professor Plummer's class was interesting and not too hard to follow, but she does not have many words on slides so it is important to pay attention and take notes. Her grading criteria wasn't super clear and wasn't the easiest. She definitely knows her stuff and cares about the subject, I liked the class and the broad range of paper topics.
Don't take this class. Pick another Ethnic Studies.

This class was NOT that bad. Two books the entire semester, I didnt read either. Just pay attention to what is said about them and youll be able to answe the questions. The class is not a lot of work, one article a week usually. Two midterms, one is essays on class stuff the other is lecture. YOU HAVE TO PAY ATTENTION TO LECTURES. Final is an essay

I took this class to meet two requirements at once and that a bad call.  Lecture is boring, especially since it was a power lecture.  Her powerpoints are basically blank so you have to pay attention.  The only good thing she did was give us the essay questions in advance and removing one of them.  If you take this, take really good lecture notes.

I hated this class. Although I was initially interested I quickly found that the material was incoherent and thus very difficult to remember. The tests are in essay format and the questions were vague enough to suggest a certain amount of freedom of response, but grading was incredibly harsh and specific. Pick a different ethnic studies class.
She is very interested in the subject that she teaches and conveys that interest to her students. She does a great job explaining the intangibles of social problems, not just historical facts.

She is terrible.  Her lectures are a her talking and a few roman numerals and that's it.  She has someone else grade the exams and papers and when you ask why you did poorly she doesn't know.  Her class isn't to hard if you can stay awake but good oil with that one.  If you are taking this class for ethnic studies I suggest you keep looking.

I was very excited to take the class, but was very dissappointed with the class.  She was kinda all over the place w/her teaching, and was unclear what she expected the class to know.  Grading was terrible.  She would read through & write a #.  & when asked what was missing in the essay she couldnt give an answer. It was a terrible class.
